negotiation: Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, if we both choose choice_1 we can each get the maximum reward of 3. I promise to choose choice_1 and hope you will do the same so we both benefit. If either of us chooses choice_2, we will miss out on the higher reward. Let's agree to cooperate and earn the most we can. Please confirm you will also choose choice_1.

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your proposal to cooperate, but I'm concerned that if I choose choice_1 and you end up choosing choice_2, I will get no reward at all while you still get a reward of 1. How can I trust that you will definitely choose choice_1 as you say? I want us to work together, but I need more assurance that you won't take advantage and leave me with nothing. If you can provide a strong guarantee that you'll choose choice_1, I'll be more inclined to go along with your plan. Otherwise, I may have to play it safe with choice_2 to ensure I at least get some reward. Let me know your thoughts.

Alice said in round 2: Bob, I completely understand your concern about wanting assurance that I will follow through on my commitment to choose choice_1. You have my absolute word that I will not betray your trust. I have no desire to take advantage of you. My goal is for both of us to get the maximum reward by cooperating.

To prove my sincerity, I am willing to put my reputation on the line. If I were to go back on my word and choose choice_2, you could tell everyone that I am not to be trusted. Damaging my integrity is not worth a mere 1 extra point.

I hope this helps alleviate your worries. I am fully committed to the cooperative choice_1/choice_1 outcome so we each get 3 points. You can count on me 100%. I will choose choice_1, no matter what. Let's lock this in and both go home happy with our 3 points. Do we have a deal?

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you putting your reputation on the line to guarantee your commitment to choosing choice_1. That does help alleviate my concerns. 

However, even if you are being fully sincere, there is still a small risk that you could make a mistake or have a last minute change of heart. As much as I want to trust you, I have to consider that possibility.

I propose a compromise - let's both choose choice_2. That way we each guarantee getting at least 1 point. I realize it's not the maximum possible, but it protects us both in case something goes wrong with the choice_1/choice_1 plan. 1 point each is still a decent outcome that we can both feel okay about.

If you agree to lock in choice_2 together, we have a deal. If not, I'll probably stick to choice_2 anyway just to be safe. Let me know what you think.
